item.title: 碧桂园逾期业绩将在行业销售下滑中出现大幅亏损
item.description: 碧桂园曾是中国最大的开发商，如今却面临清盘诉讼，分析师称，由于长期的房地产行业危机拖累了销售，预计碧桂园周二公布逾期已久的业绩时将出现大幅亏损。【原文：Country Garden, once China's top developer and now facing a liquidation lawsuit, is expected to report steep losses when it publishes long-overdue results on Tuesday, analysts say, as a prolonged property sector crisis weighed on sales.】

item.title: 中国散户投资者迅速厌恶股市
item.description: 今年第一周，日间交易员陆德龙对中国股市大涨的乐观情绪迅速消失，在对中国政府刺激经济承诺推动中国股市大涨的预期定位仅三个月后，他就被迫抛售股票并清点损失。【原文：Day-trader Lu Delong's optimism for a China stocks rally quickly evaporated in the first week of the year when, just three months after positioning for a surge fuelled by Beijing's stimulus pledges, he was forced to dump shares and tally his losses.】

item.title: 日本央行副行长表示下周有可能加息
item.description: 日本央行副行长绯野良造（Ryozo Himino）表示，随着工资持续增长的前景增强，以及美国政策前景在当选总统唐纳德-特朗普的就职演说中变得更加明朗，日本央行下周将就是否加息展开辩论。【原文：The Bank of Japan will debate whether to raise interest rates next week as prospects of sustained wage gains heighten and the U.S. policy outlook becomes clearer in President-elect Donald Trump's inaugural address, Deputy Governor Ryozo Himino said.】

item.title: 市场权衡俄罗斯制裁影响，油价维持在四个月高点附近
item.description: 石油价格周二开盘时有所下滑，但仍接近四个月高点，原因是拜登政府对俄罗斯石油实施最严厉制裁后，中国和印度买家正在寻找新的供应商。【原文：Oil prices slipped at market open on Tuesday but remained near four-month highs as Chinese and Indian buyers sought new suppliers in the wake of the Biden administration's toughest sanctions yet on Russian oil.】

item.title: 美元坚守两年高位，美国利率和关税成为焦点
item.description: 周二，美元在两年多来的最高点附近徘徊，原因是在强劲的经济数据公布后，交易商缩减了美国2025年的降息规模，而投资者对英国财政健康状况的担忧使脆弱的英镑成为焦点。【原文：The dollar hung near its highest in more than two years on Tuesday as traders scale back U.S. rate cuts in 2025 after strong economic data, while investor worries about Britain's fiscal health kept frail sterling in the spotlight.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，中国正在考虑向马斯克出售 TikTok US 的可能性
item.description: 彭博新闻社周一援引熟悉此事的人士的话报道说，中国官员正在酝酿一个潜在的方案，如果 TikTok 无法抵御潜在的禁令，就把该公司在美国的业务出售给埃隆-马斯克。【原文：Chinese officials are mulling a potential option that involves the sale of TikTok's U.S. operations to Elon Musk if the company fails to fend off a potential ban, Bloomberg News reported on Monday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 现代汽车、Stellantis、达美航空各向特朗普就职典礼基金捐款 100 万美元
item.description: 现代汽车美国分公司、克莱斯勒母公司斯特兰蒂斯公司和达美航空周一分别宣布，它们是向当选总统唐纳德-特朗普的就职基金捐款 100 万美元的公司之一。【原文：Hyundai Motor's U.S. unit, Chrysler-parent Stellantis and Delta Air Lines on Monday each announced they are among companies donating $1 million to President-elect Donald Trump's inaugural fund.】

item.title: 美国立法者敦促拜登延长 TikTok 1 月 19 日禁令的最后期限
item.description: 两位民主党议员周一敦促国会和乔-拜登总统延长中国字节跳动公司（ByteDance）1月19日出售TikTok美国资产的最后期限，否则将面临美国禁令。【原文：Two Democratic lawmakers on Monday urged Congress and President Joe Biden to extend a Jan. 19 deadline for China-based ByteDance to sell the U.S. assets of TikTok or face a U.S. ban.】

item.title: 2024 年全球电动汽车销量增长 25%，创历史新高
item.description: 本周二的数据显示，随着中国经济持续增长和欧洲经济企稳，12 月份全球纯电动汽车和插电式混合动力汽车销量连续第四个月创下历史新高，去年全球纯电动汽车和插电式混合动力汽车销量增长了四分之一，超过 1700 万辆。【原文：Global sales of fully electric and plug-in hybrid vehicles rose by a quarter last year to over 17 million cars, helped by a fourth consecutive month of record sales in December as China continued to grow and Europe stabilised, data showed on Tuesday.】

item.title: 澳大利亚 1 月份消费者信心指数下降 0.7
item.description: 周二的一项调查显示，由于新年伊始金融压力占主导地位，澳大利亚消费者情绪在1月份连续第二个月下滑，这表明短期内消费仍将受到抑制。【原文：Australian consumer sentiment dipped for a second month in January as financial stress dominated at the start of the new year, a survey showed on Tuesday, suggesting spending will remain subdued in the near term.】

item.title: 更多华尔街公司就记录保存问题与美国证券交易委员会达成和解
item.description: 监管机构周一表示，包括黑石集团（Blackstone）、阿波罗资本管理公司（Apollo Capital Management）和凯雷投资公司（Carlyle）在内的华尔街公司因违反美国证券交易委员会有关记录保存的规定，已同意支付超过 6300 万美元。【原文：Wall Street firms including Blackstone , Apollo Capital Management and Carlyle have agreed to pay more than $63 million for violating U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission rules over record-keeping, the regulator said on Monday.】

item.title: 亚马逊向戴姆勒订购 200 辆新型电动重型卡车，运往德国和英国
item.description: 亚马逊周二表示，它已向戴姆勒订购了 200 辆梅赛德斯-奔驰全电动 eActros 600 重型货运车辆，以服务德国和英国市场，这是迄今为止最大的电动卡车订单。【原文：Amazon said on Tuesday it has ordered 200 Mercedes-Benz fully-electric eActros 600 heavy goods vehicles from Daimler to serve the German and UK markets in its largest electric truck order so far.】

item.title: 夏威夷电力公司提出降低野火风险的计划
item.description: 电力供应商夏威夷电力公司（Hawaiian Electric）周一制定了一项加强电网的计划，以帮助降低由其设备引发野火的风险。【原文：Electricity provider Hawaiian Electric on Monday laid out a plan to fortify the power grid to help reduce the risk of a wildfire started by its equipment.】

item.title: 公用事业公司在洛杉矶野火中面临越来越严格的审查
item.description: 多场野火吞噬了洛杉矶数万英亩的土地，预计这将成为美国历史上损失最惨重的自然灾害，该地区的电力公司也因此受到越来越多的关注。【原文：As multiple wildfires devour tens of thousands of acres across Los Angeles in what is expected to be the most costly natural disaster in U.S. history, the area's electric utilities have come under increasing scrutiny.】

item.title: 美国劳工部与 JBS 达成协议，帮助受童工影响的人
item.description: 美国劳工部表示，已与 JBS 美国公司达成协议，该肉类包装商将提供 400 万美元，用于帮助全国范围内受非法童工行为影响的个人和社区。【原文：The U.S. Department of Labor said it entered an agreement with JBS USA in which the meatpacker will provide $4 million to assist individuals and communities affected by unlawful child labor practices nationwide.】

item.title: 与去年相比，今年美国联储银行董事会更加多样化
item.description: 美国中央银行周一公布的数据显示，2025 年美联储 12 家地区性银行的董事会在性别和种族方面更加多元化，但作为一个整体，这些银行的董事长和副董事长却没有实现多元化。【原文：The boards of directors of the Federal Reserve's 12 regional banks have grown more diverse by gender and race in 2025, data released by the U.S. central bank on Monday showed, though as a group the banks' chairs and deputy chairs have not.】

item.title: 早间竞价：美元和美国收益率挤压不减
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: Robinhood 将支付 4500 万美元，以了结美国证券交易委员会对其记录保存和其他违规行为的指控
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会周一表示，在线交易公司 Robinhood Markets 已同意支付 4500 万美元，以了结该委员会对记录保存、交易报告和其他违规行为的指控。【原文：Online trading firm Robinhood Markets has agreed to pay $45 million to settle U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission charges over record keeping, trade reporting and other rule violations, the regulator said on Monday.】

item.title: 桑迪胡克家庭就亚历克斯-琼斯破产达成和解
item.description: 律师在周一的法庭听证会上表示，因亚历克斯-琼斯对桑迪胡克大屠杀的虚假指控而起诉他的家庭已经解决了如何分割这位破产的阴谋论者资产的争议，为出售琼斯的 Infowars 平台扫清了道路。【原文：Families who have sued Alex Jones over his false claims about the Sandy Hook massacre have resolved their disputes on how to divide the bankrupt conspiracy theorist's assets, clearing the way for a sale of Jones' Infowars platform, attorneys said at a Monday court hearing.】

item.title: 彭博新闻社称，欧盟考虑扩大对马斯克 X 公司的调查范围
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周一援引欧盟科技政策负责人的话报道，欧盟正在考虑扩大对埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的社交媒体网络 X 是否违反其内容审核规则的调查。【原文：The European Union is considering expanding its investigation into whether Elon Musk's social media network X breached its content moderation rulebook, Bloomberg News reported on Monday, citing the bloc's tech policy chief.】

item.title: 麦当劳因拉丁裔奖学金问题被起诉，尽管其撤销了多元化举措
item.description: 一个反对平权法案的团体提起诉讼，指责麦当劳最近通过继续保留向拉丁裔和西班牙裔学生颁发奖学金的计划，收回了几项多元化举措，指责麦当劳走得不够远。【原文：A group opposed to affirmative action filed a lawsuit accusing McDonald's of not going far enough when it recently rolled back several diversity initiatives by continuing to maintain a program that awards scholarships to Latino and Hispanic students.】

item.title: 巴西努班克与便利店 Oxxo 合作拓展墨西哥市场
item.description: 巴西数字贷款公司 Nubank 周一宣布，已与墨西哥 FEMSA 旗下的墨西哥连锁便利店 Oxxo 签订协议，将在北美国家扩展其现金存取网络。【原文：Brazilian digital lender Nubank has signed an agreement with Mexican convenience store chain Oxxo, run by FEMSA , to expand its cash deposit and withdrawal network in the North American country, the firms announced on Monday.】

item.title: 美国上周原油和馏分油库存可能下降，汽油库存增加
item.description: 路透社周一的初步民意调查显示，预计上周美国原油和馏分油库存将下降，汽油库存将上升。【原文：U.S. crude oil and distillate stockpiles are expected to have fallen last week and gasoline inventories to have risen, a preliminary Reuters poll showed on Monday.】

item.title: 雪佛龙从 UPS 聘用新的首席企业事务官
item.description: 美国石油生产商雪佛龙公司（Chevron）周一宣布，已聘请一名新的副总裁负责政府事务、沟通和社会投资活动。【原文：Chevron has hired a new vice president to oversee government affairs, communications and social investment activities, the U.S. oil producer announced on Monday.】

item.title: 飞利浦首席执行官认为今年中国市场销售低迷
item.description: 飞利浦公司首席执行官罗伊-雅各布斯（Roy Jakobs）表示，由于中国政府在医疗保健领域的反腐行动损害了西方公司在中国的收入，他预计今年中国市场的需求仍将受到抑制。【原文：Philips CEO Roy Jakobs said he still expects subdued demand in China this year due to healthcare anti-corruption efforts by the Chinese government that has hurt revenue there for Western companies.】

item.title: 辉瑞公司首席执行官布尔拉表示将 "全力以赴 "开发肥胖症药物
item.description: 美国制药商辉瑞公司首席执行官阿尔伯特-布尔拉（Albert Bourla）在周一举行的摩根大通医疗保健会议上表示，辉瑞公司正在 "全力以赴 "开发肥胖症实验药物，并一直在招募更多这方面的专家。【原文：U.S. drugmaker Pfizer is going "all in" to develop its experimental obesity drug and has been recruiting more experts in that area, Chief Exeuctive Officer Albert Bourla said at the JPMorgan Healthcare Conference on Monday.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，礼来公司要求美国政府暂停药品价格谈判
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周一援引首席执行官大卫-里克斯的话报道，礼来公司已要求美国政府暂停处方药的价格谈判。【原文：Eli Lilly has asked the U.S. government to pause price negotiations for prescription drugs, Bloomberg News reported on Monday, citing CEO David Ricks.】

item.title: 备忘录显示，高盛任命了新成立的资本解决方案集团的领导人
item.description: 根据路透社周一看到的一份内部备忘录，高盛在成立一个新部门后宣布了一系列领导层变动，该部门将专注于大型交易融资和为企业客户提供贷款。【原文：Goldman Sachs has announced a raft of leadership changes after creating a new division, which will focus on financing large deals and providing loans to corporate clients, according to an internal memo seen by Reuters on Monday.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，爱迪生公用事业公司因设备在洛杉矶野火中的作用而遭到起诉
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周一报道，爱迪生国际公司旗下的南加州公用事业公司遭到诉讼，指责该能源供应商的设备引发了加州的一场野火。【原文：Edison International's southern California utility was hit with a lawsuit blaming the energy provider's equipment for igniting one of the wildfires in California, Bloomberg News reported on Monday.】

item.title: 独家：贝莱德退出后，投资者气候组织暂停活动
item.description: 在全球最大的投资者贝莱德（BlackRock）因美国的政治反弹而退出后几天，一个旨在使资产管理行业与全球气候目标保持一致的旗舰联盟周一表示，它将暂停活动。【原文：A flagship coalition aimed at aligning the asset management industry with global climate goals said it was suspending its activities on Monday, days after BlackRock , the world's biggest investor, left amid a political backlash in the United States.】
